item.title: Cat.III Logistics Coordinator
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
EU-China Young Farmers Programme

This action will contribute to PI Objective 1: To enhance EU bilateral, regional, inter-regional and multilateral cooperation and partnership strategies through reinforcement of policy dialogues. The action will address this objective in particular through reinforcement of policy dialogue on agriculture and the development, the adoption and the implementation of collective approaches and responses to challenges of global and/or mutual concern, in particular in the areas of sustainable agriculture and rural development.

The Overall Objective of the action is to improve EU-China cooperation on agriculture:

  • Through improved uptake of modern and sustainable techniques and practices in farming, food transformation and rural development resulting from the know-how and experiences shared between the EU and China and capacity built among young farmers
  • Through further dissemination of recommendations and good practices to practitioners and policy makers in China. The Agenda 2030 and COP 21 implementation offer a momentum for Chinese Authorities to re-orient their policies. Experiences with the young farmers' generation could play its role in that respect;
  • By providing opportunities to establish closer links between agri-food businesses, national and regional authorities in Europe and future young professional working in the agricultural sector in China;
  • For the EU MS farmers, the participation in the workshops and study visits in China will allow them to get to know the realities and best practices of the Chinese agricultural model. For the sector’s professionals this will be important experience.

The Specific Objectives of the action will be to:

  • Inform in an interactive and practice-oriented way young Chinese farmers and sector professionals of the modern and sustainable techniques and practices in farming, food transformation, quality and safety standards and rural development in the EU;
  • Compare the EU know-how and best practices with the experiences of the Chinese farmers and the sector policy environment in China and possibly use in the EU experiences and knowhow acquired through the project;
  • Build the relevant capacities among the participants;
  • Identify good practices and disseminate this knowledge and experience to a wider audience in rural areas and policy makers. Identification of added value of certain EU farming practices, and of practical young farmer policies, by Chinese participants should be a source of inspiration for the Chinese authorities which are in the process of a major agricultural policy reform which might, in the future, have huge impacts on world agricultural markets, global food security and stability in China (nexus rural-urban areas).

Location visits: Brussels, 2 EU member states TBD, selected Chinese provinces Project duration: 18 months

Logistics Coordinator

Qualification and skills

  • Education at the level of BSc Degree or instead 3 years of professional experience in
  • addition to the general experience in a sector related to the task involved.
  • Working experience in project management, logistics, organisation of seminars, events and study group visits.
  • Excellent communication and organisational abilities.
  • Proficiency in English (spoken, written and comprehension).

Assets

  • Proficiency in Mandarin Chinese and/or any other European languages.
  • Working experience in China or with Chinese authorities in a field related to the Assignment

Civil servants and other staff of the public administration of China, regardless of their administrative situation, shall not be recruited as experts

item.title: Senior Expert in Decentralisation/ Local Development/ Governance (TL)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mainstreaming Local Authorities as developmental actors through a territorial approach in EC supported programmes

Global objective

The overall objective of the project (of which this contract will be a part) is to provide strategic and operational support to EC staff in EUDs and HQ in translating the new EC policy vision on Local Authorities as developmental actors through a territorial approach in EC supported programs and projects (bilateral support and thematic line CSO-LA). This support will be provided in line with the EC Communication “Empowering Local Authorities in partner countries for enhanced governance and more effective development outcomes”(May 2013) and with the EC Ref Doc n° 23 “Supporting decentralisation, Local Governance and Local development in partner countries through a territorial approach".

Specific objective

The purpose of this contract is to set up and run a demand-driven mechanism for the mobilisation of a set of experts in the field of Decentralization Reforms, Local Governance and Local Development, in order to strengthen the capacity of the EC Delegations’ staff operating in partner countries, to translate the new EU policy framework on decentralization and Local Authorities into consistent EU-supported analytical activities, programs and projects.

Senior Expert in Decentralisation/ Local Development/ Governance (TL)

  • A minimum of 12 year’s professional experience in development cooperation / international relations;
  • At least 5 years’ experience in the design and implementation of programs aiming at supporting decentralisation reforms, local development and Local Governance in developing countries;
  • At least 5 years of experience as a coordinator of teams implementing EU support programs in the field of decentralisation, local Governance and/or Local development in partner countries;
  • Experience in designing and conducting studies and analysis in fields related the assignment, and in drafting related terms of references;
  • Experience in mainstreaming of local authorities in overall EU development cooperation;
  • Sound knowledge of EC aid modalities (budget support, project approach) as well as aid delivery mechanism;
  • Minimum 5 years professional experience in organising and delivering seminars and workshop related to decentralisation reforms, local and territorial development, territorial approaches and the mainstreaming of LAs in EU supported programs and projects with excellent facilitation and presentation skills;
  • Excellent drafting and oral presentation skills;
  • Previous experience in the context of the Thematic Programme CSO-LA and/or its predecessor will be an asset;
  • Fluent in English, French and Spanish. Portuguese will be an asset

item.title: Electoral System Assessment Expert (cat. II)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Review of the Strengthening Democracy through Electoral Reform Sector Reform Contract

Global objective The overall objective is to provide a detailed review of the implementation of the Strengthening Democracy through Electoral Reform SRC 2015 and to enable the EU to use the outcomes of the reviews for decisions on instalment disbursement and programme execution.

Specific objective The specific objective is to conduct review missions, one during the fiscal year 2017 for the disbursement of the second variable instalment, another one during 2018 for the final variable instalment.

  • The first review mission will verify compliance with conditions attached to the release of the second tranche. The conclusions of the first review mission will be used to decide upon the disbursement of the second variable instalment of the SRC (€3 mill), indicatively scheduled for the second quarter of 2017;
  • The second review mission will verify compliance with conditions and/or achievements of targets attached to the release of the third tranche. The conclusions of the second review mission will be used to decide upon the disbursement of the third (final) variable instalment under the programme (€3 mill), indicatively by the second quarter of 2018.
